Reviews.Title: “something fishy...”
Reviews.Author: Imani K
Reviews.Content: ask for a receipt. go ahead and try. check the room before you pay. be careful of the sneaky, dwarfish owner. rates seem reasonable...unless the owner's in a bad mood...bring some incense sticks or air freshner. great location.

Reviews.Title: “A few minor issues but overall a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FreeSpirit246246
Reviews.Content: Positive points: excellent location (supermarket over the road, MTR around the corner), fridge & small kitchen to make your own food, clean rooms, social common area, free wifi in the common room and our room (on 2nd floor), free water refill, large lockers in the dorm (bring own padlock), AC dorm. Negative points: astonishingly hard beds (one bed in the 3-bed dorm was softer so this could be luck of the draw), and a smoky common room without AC. Dodgy lift - after getting stuck we took the stairs! This hostel seems to be the banner for several smaller hostels - we booked "Kingston Inn" and ended up with a room in "Asia Inn". Reception is hard to find; the posters in several of the lobbies we entered warned against illegal guesthouses, leading us to think it had been closed down (in the end, the rooms were marked as legal with a sticker on the door). The directions from our booking were hopeless and the security guards in the lobbies are unhelpful. Reception (on the 3rd floor of the Paterson Building) staff is brusque but helpful enough (some friends found the service rude).

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service but good location”
Reviews.Author: lill-miss-sunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our rtw trip so chose this hostel due to the price and location. The room was tiny, with tiny vented window and tiny bathroom. The bed was hard and we asked numerous times during our stay for a better room but were fobbed off all the time being told that they were full. They put an extra duvet under the bed sheet to make it softer. In the entrance to the building there was a sign saying that the hostel is illegal and also in the lift there was a sign stating that it is illegal. The reception area has a toaster and small kitchette and we needed to come here to use the wifi as it didn't work in the room. Other people were smoking here so it wasn't very pleasant for spending a lot of time in. The man at reception was rude and not very helpful and could not find our booking upon arrival so he ended up asking us what price we'd been quoted even though we'd booked it directly through the hostel's own website. The location is good though. 2 min walk to the underground/subway/metro. Lots of shops and restaurant nearby and there was also a supermarket across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Best for rest”
Reviews.Author: Alfapratama
Reviews.Content: I think HK Hostel the best hostel di HK island. Depend on location, its very strategic. Located in the area Couseway, there are many shops, include IKEA. If you want to get into the Patterson building, you must know the password no building entrances. You can ask for the password to the hostel manager by email. For the payment, you can swipe your debit/credit card.

Reviews.Title: “78 severe bed-bug bites. WARNING - Graphic proof.”
Reviews.Author: ceevee369
Reviews.Content: My wife didn't want to spend 1000+ HKD for a room so one of her friends booked a room with Hong Kong Hostels for 2 nights -situated at nr 47 Patterson Street. Upon arrival, she was told to go to the building on nr 51 - having appointed room 528(?) to her. She spotted an insect on the bed (see picture) , thinking it was a small roach- thus "normal" in cheap 1 or 2 star hostels / rooms - and did not bother. Next morning, she woke up with itching pain and many red dots. She had been bitten 78 times all over the body by bed bugs. Now, back in Taiwan she is under heavy anti-biotic medication, can barely sleep at night because of the pain and itchiness. Not to mention the medical costs which combined are a higher price as a 4-star hotel in HK. I'd like to inform / complain towards the Hong Kong Health Department but am afraid it won't make any difference as 1 and 2 star parasite hostels are most likely not their concern. Therefore I post a warning here. Avoid the building on nr 51 !!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hostel Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: bp567924
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a private room for 5 nights and can't complain much. It is difficult to find a place in this price range NOT located in Chunking Mansion, which wet heard awful things about. I'll talk about the cons first. The room was hard as a rock, one power outlet, and a broken TV. The computers (which they made with parts) are always turned off to prevent overheating. Staff can (will) not answer any questions so your best bet is to grab a map and ask on the street. Pros were quiet street, fairly clean room (which they have people do everyday), shower had good pressure, and the best thing was location. It's just minutes from supermarket, mtr, and Times Square. Not too many cheap restaurants, but you can find them if your ask the locals. Laundry close by too, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best location !”
Reviews.Author: karmen4728
Reviews.Content: I love the location so so much! It's very convenient and I like the street - paterson street! We booked for a dorm price and we get a private room for 2 person, private bathroom included.. I think I will visit again to this hostel in my next visit to Hong Kong. The only thing that I do not satisfied is the bed.."hard rock" bed...and the WIFI is not that stable at the 10th floor.

Reviews.Title: “The only hostel to stay in in HK.”
Reviews.Author: dmc1989
Reviews.Content: As far as hostels in Hong Kong go, this is the best, The price is fantastic given its central location in Causeway Bay. Rooms are split across several floors so in-room wifi is a nightmare, I had to balance on the stairwell to get 2 bars of signal. The staff are friendly and willing to help. The rooms...well, they're tiny! But this is HK so you can't expect much. Very close to metro station, supermarket, cafes, cinema....everything!

Reviews.Title: “Just for sleep”
Reviews.Author: DomingosLao
Reviews.Content: - great location in causeway bay - easy to find - got free wifi and computers (but in-room wifi maybe quite weak, depend on your room's location) - very friendly reception - bed is quite small, but clean enough - main reason is low cost...compare to other hotels in this district!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A few days in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Tinkspurple
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days here. I went for a bed in the 3 bed female dorm which had air con and lockers. The beds were hard but ok. The hostel is basic but has a geat location and is very good for the price in HK. From the outside you wouldn't know that there was a hostel on the 3rd floor. The staff at first seemed a little off but I think I must have arrived at a busy spell and they were a bit flustered. After this the staff were lovely, very helpful and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingPress
Reviews.Content: From seeing so many reviews of this place I didn't really expect much, in fact I was concerned. But overall it's an average no frills stay kind of a place Pros: -Very close to the Metro on the Blue line -Nice, safe and quiet after 11pm area -Our beds were clean and not rock hard but by no means soft, doable for a couple nights -Good and free Wi-Fi as well as use of computers in main building -Good A/C -Our Apartment area had two bathrooms which was good considering the amount of people -The owner let us keep our stuff in one of the lockers free of charge after we checked out Cons: -Rooms are small, better off staying in the open area mixed dorm -One of our toilets consistently didn't work -No locks for the locker free of charge, better off bringing your own lock -Our apartment wasn't connected to the main service desk which had we needed it would have been a nuisance -Our main annoyance was since it was in such a posh area it was damn near impossible to find CHEAP/LOCAL food one of the things Hong Kong is known for! For a short stay you could probably do better but not at the price or the location. Don't expect luxury but don't believe the horror stories! A satisfactory experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: SebbyAn
Reviews.Content: I would come back because the prices were reasonable, its in a good location and very close to the MTR which connects you to everything. there's also a grocery store 300m from the hostel for your everyday needs.. I was a bit confused whether the location was posh area because we couldn't afford anything at the stores around.hahah..you are on the same street with the likes of Burberry and MaxMARA...locating the hotel was a bit difficult, because no signs were put up, and then when you call Mr. SAM you can barely hear him, but he is friendly. Service was great no complaints, bed is stiff as rock, but you rarely in the dorm sleeping because you out exploring(try to come back as late as possible, limit your hours on that bed) the rooms are clean, WiFi and they give you a t.v the size of a dot, it was rarely on plus it was all in Cantonese. Don't expect the RITZ-CARLTON because that is not what you paying for!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Erinqm
Reviews.Content: I love it here. Got myself a decent single room. Bed was a tad hard and theres no heater during winter so can get a bit cold. No towels too but i brought my own and didnt ask owner for one. Hot shower available, even have a tv and dressing table in room. Toilet and room was cleaned daily. Owner,Mr Sam was friendly. Didn't check out the pantry though. But if you live in HK, you should eat out. Overall, I would be staying here again 4 more times this year. Join me? :p

Reviews.Title: “Long Gone in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Manny_Travels
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong Hostel was my first stay at a hostel in Hong Kong. The location is ideal on Paterson about two blocks from Causeway Bay Road and a few more blocks from Causeway Bay MTR subway. The area itself is filled with a fair bit of coffee shops, stores, and restaurants. Now for the hostel itself;-) The front desk is on the third floor of the building and the hostel rooms are on the 10th floor of the building. I stayed with two friend in a two bed room with a double sized bed and a single size bed. The double sized bed has a slide out in the bottom, however it was blocked by the night stand between the two beds, essentially making the slide out useless. The mattresses were dusty as were the sheets and comforters, I would question their cleanliness. There was toilet/shower in the room with average cleanliness. The front desk manager was kind and spoke English very well, however service was average. The power outlets in our room were shorted out; when brought to their attention they insisted that it was our converter. We tested our converter at a nearby Starbucks and it worked fine. Nonetheless, they stood by their perspective. There are three computers for use in the lobby with wifi available as well. The wifi signal was strong enough to handle email use and searching relatively well in regards to speed. The guests that arrived to Hong Kong hostel during my stay were a mix of European travellers: eastern, western, Mediterranean, etc. A majority seemed to mind to their personal business; not much interaction between travelers seen as often as many other hostels or meccas of backpackers. Given the location, if cleanliness and service improved, the Hong Kong Hostel could easily be a 5 point hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met and exceeded”
Reviews.Author: CapeTown2HongKong
Reviews.Content: It was with dread that myself and 7 other family members made our way to the hostel. We have read all the reviews but were determined to make the best of whatever situation. We were on a shoestring budget with very little alternatives as accommodation in HK is exorbitant. Our arrival did not spell anything good. Admittedly we had changed our accommodation thrice and the guy at the reception desk was unhappy and asked us to wait. We managed to negotiate a very decent rate once we viewed the rooms and found it above what we expected... it was really pleasing! We were given 3 rooms in a "Guest House" which proved to be excellent. The rooms, bedding and toilets were clean, the hot showers available. The cleaner made her rounds at least 3 times daily. We had access to drinking water (hot and cold) and we were in the heart of the bustling, vibey shopping district of Causeway Bay. It was close to all amenities and we traveled by bus to all the major shopping and sightseeing areas. This location is awesome. We all agreed it was not 5star, but it more than adequately serviced our needs. The only thing lacking was Wifi which was non-existent in our area. We had to drink expensive coffee at Starbucks to access Wifi. The bunk beds in the 4 sleeper was a bit squeaky but we really enjoyed our stay. We got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “My whole body bleed”
Reviews.Author: Vuvie
Reviews.Content: I was assigned Hong Kong hostel by the conference organiser. If only I knew... Let me put it this way, I don't think I am a princess but unfortunately, I have very delicate skin. I developed horrible rash all over my body from 4 nights and I've even bought a new duvet from Ikea to cover everything. Turns out the comforter is extremely dirty and most probably have never met the washing machine. Since it was a 5 beds room, I changed the comforter with one from another bed where no one is sleeping and I slept through the 5th night without itching all over. I went to the doctor 2 times and was diagnosed with bed bites and eczema. The only reason I couldn't move out earlier was due to the Christmas season and all hostels/hotels were around USD300 and above. I managed to move out after the 4th night. Never again do I want to see this Hong Kong Hostel.... And yes, I speak Cantonese and Mandarin, have a hard time trying to talk to the dodgy people who run the place. I wrote this to my friend after the first night there: It's like.... a family was gonna move in, then during the renovation had a fight, got seperated and left the house. There's a broken broom and a wooden ladder. Then when this family left, someone else found this place and turn it into a intermediate ho hostel. Imagine, the room is like your room, with 6 beds / 3 double deck. They aren't even symmetrically placed. Then, maybe the family came back, had a huge fight and one of them threw the broom at the other party but he managed to duck in time. Unfortunately, it flew past him and broke the glass window behind him. They left but just to make sure no locusts fly into the house, they'd stuffed the window shut with cardboards. At night, when it got really windy, we don't just get a draft, there's a gale. There's a fridge but it's warm and smells moldy. The hot water works most of the time except one morning but I still shower anyway. I think I got bug bites and I'd just got a whole lotta meds. There's a small tv, but I think it's a paperweight.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION, POOR CONDITIONS”
Reviews.Author: stephanieahensley
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I have not stayed at a hostel in a long time. But hotels in Hong Kong are getting exorbitant, and Hong Kong Hostel seemed like a good and inexpensive alternative. The location of the hostel is the best thing about it...in the center of Causeway Bay's bustling shopping area and a 2 minutes' walk to the MTR subway station. Unfortunately I was not impressed with the condition of the hostel itself. The lobby was fine, the rooms were fairly clean but sparse. There was no heat and only a light duvet, which in HK in the winter can be lacking, and I found myself shivering while sleeping. I had paid a bit extra and booked a 3 bed female only dorm room, and when I arrived from a night of HK fun, I went into my room, and there was a man sleeping in one of the beds. When I went to the front desk to complain, they said a girl is staying there and has a guy friend that is sick so he will stay the night. They asked if it was ok with me, but when I expressed that it wasn't, they had no alternative options, and didn't offer anything to make up for this issue. All in all, if you need a place to spend the night, you can do it here...it is one of the cheapest deals I have found in HK, but it comes at a price. It is a good reason to stay out and have a night on the town in HK!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marica36
Reviews.Content: good enough place given what we paid for; close to coffee shops, shops (sogo & times square), MTR, taxi stand & a 24 hr grocery; a bit tricky to find - lobby located in the 3rd floor of a building with no sign; was asked to go to another building (same owner) since they were fully booked

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would go back”
Reviews.Author: WeeTanWee
Reviews.Content: HK is very crowded, tiny and bloody pricey apartments mashed alongside shops/departmental stores, some of the worst service in Asia, non-english speaking public, workings that defy common logic... if you understand what the country is like, you'll get why some reviews are as they are If you're looking to stay on HK Island/not too far from shopping or partying - location is brilliant! it is literally 6min from the metro station (Causeway Bay exit E) and smack right in the middle of a smart shopping district, not a sketch lil alley way... It's a HKD40 cab ride from the party area of Lan Kwai Fong (which is wicked). Good food options nearby as well. Shopping in Jardine Crescent is rubbish despite what guide books seem to say. Service wise, I think they definitely have taken reviews seriously and worked on it. The guy at the reception was great, gave us advice on food/shopping/partying/police stations/airport info, etc and was chatty and friendly every single time I met him. Considering English is probably his 3rd language, be a little patient!! Some of the other staff speak only cantonese, so can't fault them for not trying to make conversation with me. Had a 4 bed female dorm, #217, and also saw #313, 3 bed female dorm. Both rooms were clean, clean en suites, hot water, great air con, linen, pillow, quilt, cups, TV, soap and shampoo dispensers. Some rooms have lockers and some don't. Very sufficient for a hostel in a country like HK (or Singapore). Mate was saying the bed was quite hard, didn't really affect me though 3 computer terminals, all working. You get what you pay for and in HK, for 20 bucks, this is great!

Reviews.Title: “May want to look elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: alvinchia79
Reviews.Content: First the good things: good location and its price. Can't beat it in HK considering its central location. The availability of the kitchen is also a plus since you may want to cook that pack of instant noodles dead in the night. Then again, food is plenty around the clock in HK so not a biggie. Bad things: Customer service was poor and this frustrates me most of the time as a hostel is meant to be a friendly communal place and the last place you want to experience bad service. And there's only 1 computer that worked?? The dorms had some smell but fortunately the air-con works. The working of other things like the door lock, tv is dependent on your luck at times.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, decent size room, shame service was poor.”
Reviews.Author: becgrice
Reviews.Content: Got to hostel to be told in a round about way they had double booked our room even though we paid a deposit, emailed 2 weeks before we went too. We were taken across the road to a dingy hostel for the first night in a 3 bed room (we needed 4) there was a mattress on the floor for the 4th bed. We were told come back across in the morning at 11am. We did this and after being messed around for over 2 hours (we had planned a day trip too) we eventually got the room after losing our patience. The room was a good size, website said you got towels everyday but we just got one on the floor for when we got out of shower. It was not cleaned at all, just bin emptied, we stayed 5 nights. Had free wifi in the room. The location was excellent, the staff did not appear very friendly although the owner did try and make it up to us by given my children cold drinks and letting us use his printer for free. I think they were quite busy and possibly this is why the mistake was made but i think if they had told us the truth and apologised instead of not letting us know what was going on with the room it would have helped.

Reviews.Title: “liars run this place”
Reviews.Author: candc222
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and daughter for the Final Sale in HK. Booked the room via phone one month prior. Sam quoted HK$580. A week prior our trip we called Sam again to reconfirm - same price quoted, HK$580. HOWEVER, when we got there at past 10am, they had no room for us. According to them the rooms were being cleaned. That was ok since we knew that official check-in won't be until 1pm. So, we told reception we'll just return by 1pm. They told us THE LATER THE BETTER. Should have been alarmed upon hearing this but we gave them the benefit of the doubt. We returned to the hotel by past 5pm. Upon conversing with reception, we were told that the room we booked was at $680! We demanded to talk to Sam however were told that he was on his day off. Got to talk with Peter instead. He insisted that it was peak season (true enough, there were a lot of Westerners trying to check-in); however, the point is, this was not the price they quoted! Could it be that, ONE WEEK prior our booking, they just OVERLOOKED that it was gonna be peak season by the time of our booking?! Highly unlikely! Even the Westerners that checked-in the same time we did were quoted $100 higher than published rates. Major rip-off! They obviously took advantage of the hordes of tourists looking for a place to stay! We would have checked-in to another hotel however it was getting late. This was when we realized what THE LATER THE BETTER meant -- to leave unsatisfied guests no choice but still stay there coz there were no other hotels available. And, adding to the damage they already caused, on our last day, at 12pm sharp (check-out time), they kept calling our room to ask us to check out already! We argued that, since they couldn't give us a room on time during the first day, the least they could do was extend the check out time even for a bit. Needless to say, our pleas fell on deaf ears. Tsk Tsk! There are better places to stay at in HK. My two cents': don't choose Hong Kong Hostel!

Reviews.Title: “horrible people run this place”
Reviews.Author: nothappy123294217
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days and then tried to book it again because I couldn't find anywhere else. first they put me in an awful tiny room with 8 beds crammed in and when I complained because I had booked a smaller room they moved me to a room where you could hardly even stand up in but at least it had less beds. It was not very clean, rubbish under the beds, lots of junk left behind by previous tenants, and the bed was really uncomfortable. the people who run this place were really rude and unhelpful, overall an unpleasant experience, don't go there

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you're on a budget...great location!”
Reviews.Author: anettebc
Reviews.Content: The only good things about this hostel are location (causeway) & price (HK is expensive)This hostel is located in a resindential building 2nd & 3rd floors. Elevators are slow and always full... plan to climb. Website advertises cheaper rooms, but when you get there is always more. Customer service was poor Lobby was very hot and aircon didn't work, Computers free but only one worked, WIFI was really slow and sometimes didn't connect. Smoking is allowed in the lobby. There was a kitchen and fridge next to the lobby, if you want to buy groceries or snacks and prepare food. (no Aircon) We heard, it was much better than Chung king Mansions Double room Very small w/ TV english channels, aircon, window, tiny bathroom w/ hot water (good water pressure). WIFI worked. Overall ok 4-bed dorms Very small, stinky, poor ventilation, aircon worked, good lockers, restroom inside (doors didn't close and you could hear everything) no floor space for walking when fully occupaid. There was a tv on the corner really hard to use. WIFI worked very very very slow and only after midnight. I would only recomend it, if you are on a tide budget, since location is nice and safe. If budget allows get a double instead of dorms.

Reviews.Title: “Its cheap, great location, but basic”
Reviews.Author: starbuck251
Reviews.Content: In the heart of HK island where space is very expensive and at a premium, this I felt, for the money, was a pretty decent hostel. I stayed in a 4 bed mixed dorm on the 3rd floor. Ok, so the beds were hard, and the bathroom basic, but it's somewhere to sleep and base yourself to see the real Hong Kong. Just a few minutes walk from Causeway Bay exit E, and the tram stop, it is in a fantastic location, and for the $150 per night I paid, was the one of the cheapest places that was pretty decent (if you've seen Chungking mansions, you'd know how awful they were!). the internet access was very poor, frustratingly, but hey its a cheap place. Despite all this, I stayed there 3 weeks because I could afford to, and enjoyed my time and the location for getting everywhere else. There;s shops, restaurants and a 24 hour supermarket across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay in this hostel”
Reviews.Author: Single_A_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I booked this hostel online, because it is very close to MRT station and in the heart of the touristic part of Kowloon, the southern part of the mainland. BUT: the stuff is absolutely unfriendly and ignoring, shouting, not helpful at all, the rooms are terrible, and loud, the walls thin. You can hear all the AC-noises and waterpumps from your neighbours, and you smell all the citchen dust of the places below. They offer hot water, but it is only working in case you are the very first person in the morning. After this the water is cold, no fun when room temperature is below 15 celcius. I wanted to change my very poor double deluxe room, which was almost below standard, had no window to let fresh air in, and they refused. They offer Wifi, but you have to sit in a garbage room where the door is always open to the outside area, which makes no sense, when the outside temperature is around 10 celcius. In case you want to stay in this area, in this building there are 30 different guest houses on 16 floors, so it is no need to book a specific one in advance, you just come here and somebody on the street will ask you for a room, and it is up to your disposition to choose what you like or not. Since I paid all nights in advance on arrival, my hands were tied. So this is a very serious warning.

Reviews.Title: “Staff has to ask the boss”
Reviews.Author: wallis013
Reviews.Content: Nice guests, good location. Now the negatives: Staff wont speak english, they have nice tv's and PS3 and stuff but THE boss only watches Chinese tv and only plays himself. Only 3 mins of hot water.. Find somethin better!!

Reviews.Title: “Got horrible skin rash from the dirty sheets”
Reviews.Author: Magusgulf
Reviews.Content: The location was super, but they had quite some trouble to find our reservation, even though we had paid a deposit! Very unfortunately when I woke up next morning both my hands and neck were full of what seemed like flea bites!! When I went to the doctor back home (6 days later) he told me it was in fact a skin reaction. First time in 29 years! Sleep here only if you have hardened skin, otherwise look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good clean no frills lodging in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jeanolivia
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay if you only need a place to sleep at night. It was clean and relatively comfortable ( I don't like the hard Asian beds) and was in a great location. Finding it the first time was slightly problematic and the person at the entrance was down right rude. However, once we got to the Hostel, the staff was very helpful and friendly, although there wasn't always someone around who spoke English. The biggest complaint was the lack of internet access on the floor we were on, but it was available in the main office. All in all, it was definitely a good bargain and I would stay there again on a budget trip.

Reviews.Title: “Recomendable para un enemigo”
Reviews.Author: Balmad
Reviews.Content: lo único bueno del hostal era su buena localización. El edificio era moderno y tenía buena pinta, ahora, nunca he estado en nada igual. No sé como puede haber críticas positivas. La única explicación sería que hay habtiaciones muy distintas, ahora nosotros eramos un grupo de 16, y todas nuestras habitaciones eran malas. La habitación alucinante. Sucia. Era cuádruple. Dos camas individuales y una de matrimonio enana. Los colchones eran durísimo, de verdad, si le dabas un puñetazo te rompías la amno. Además tenían unas fundas de plástico bastante asquerosas. El cuarto no tenía ventanas, bueno, tenía una ventana que se abría a la mitad pero chocaba con el edificio mugriento de en frente, que estaba a unos 10 centimetros, así que mejor no abrirla, bastante asqueroso. El cuarto de baño era una cuartito enano con un retrete, un lavabo y una ducha todo junto. No había separación entre ambos, así que se mojaba todo. La puerta estaba rota y faltaban trozos así que también se mojaba el cuarto. Por supuesto no había ni toalleros ni nada de eso. Lo más increíble era el cuarto de baño común, para las habitaciones que no tenían. Alucinante. Era también el cuarto de la limpieza así que estaba lleno de cajas, de fregonas, cubos, etc. Todo muy sucio. La sitaución era tal, que optaron por hacer sus necesidades en un cubo. Lo peor es que pagábamos 20€ cabeza. Pensábamos que ibamos a un hostal como los europeos, sencillo pero limpio y cómodo. Nada que ver. No recomiendo en absoluto, Bastantes personas de mi grupo no se ducharon los dos días que estuvimos allí del asco que les daba el hostal en general y los cuartos de baño en particular. La guinda fue la cucaracha que apareció en la mesilla de noche el último día. Si tenéis un enemigo mandadle aquí.

Reviews.Title: “The best location to stay in hong kong...”
Reviews.Author: Hcoe21
Reviews.Content: The best location to stay in hong kong. The rooms are basic, but very clean and comfy. The staff are helpfull too. There is a sign outside saying that the hostel is illegal but this is not a problem and has been an ongoing dispute for many years with the owners of the building, don't let this put you off! There is a free computer room too. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst beds on earth”
Reviews.Author: malmn1976
Reviews.Content: You pay for what you get I guess...the rooms were tiny, the AC was too strong and uncontrolable, and the beds were so hard and you could feel EVRY spring. Awful! Worst beds on this planet. The only positive was the great location in Causway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, dingy rooms, rude & unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: smokeysabs
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was small and dirty. Its located on the edge of a big shopping area but a couple subway stops away from the main shopping and tourist area. The staff were incredibly rude and unhelpful. Most of the staff are not able to speak English and if they can it is very limited. This was strange because most of the other people I encountered in Hong Kong spoke English very well. They were unable to give advice about simple things for example... When I asked about a good place to get tea they recommended McDonalds. When both of the computers & internet broke in the hostel & I asked where I could find an internet cafe they told me to go outside on the street but could not give me any more specifics. The common area with the internet access is very small and cramped and is locked up from 23:00 to 6:00. It is not a very good place for meeting fellow travelers.

HotelInfo.Name: Hong Kong Hostel
HotelInfo.Address: 3 F, Block A, 47 Paterson Street, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong, China
